name: The Kimberly Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just got back from a long weekend in NYC. We were very pleased with our accommodation at The Kimberly. The room was quiet, clean and spacious. The hotel is conveniently placed - we arrived in time to enjoy the pedestrian Saturday on Lex, with all the vendors and stalls - and just a short walk to .... well ..... everything! The staff was helpful and attentive. We had a great stay.
reviews.title: convenience and comfort

reviews.text: We stayed in the tall tower. Our room had a comfortable living room and a balcony with a view & a nice kitchen area. The bed was super comfortable. The only negative was the shower head that did not have good water pressure - it just drooled on you instead of spraying you. The staff were very nice and helpful since we got there before our room was ready.
reviews.title: I would definately stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Kimberly Hotel on August 4-6, 2012 and we had a great time. We stayed in a large room with a king-size bed (7i) on the 7th floor. Bathroom was a decent size too. Our room was very clean, with a comfortable bed and a large flat-screen tv. Bathrobes and sleepers were provided.
reviews.title: really nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two things that made me rate this hotel only as "very goo" rather than "excellent": breakfast was not included and internet in the room was not free.
reviews.title: A Jewel in the concrete jungle...

reviews.text: Location was great: a block away from a subway stop, about 10-minutes away from the Grand Central, and a 30-min ride from LaGuardia.
reviews.title: Kimberley apartment

reviews.text: The Kimberly was wonderful. It was full yet I never heard any noise from the hallway. My bed was extremely comfortable; I rarely sleep as well as I did on this visit. The staff was professional. My air handler was a little noisy but everything else was great. They even had Neutrogena products in the room; nice!
reviews.title: Cozy Little Place

likes.disliked: — It was a little farther from the park than I prefer to stay

reviews.text: My husband and I took our 14 and 16-year old daughters to NYC for 10 days, and I CAN'T RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL HIGHLY ENOUGH!
reviews.title: The PERFECT hotel for a family vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I used to travel to NYC on business every few weeks, and finding a spacious hotel room at ANY price can be a challenge. I really wanted the girls to see New York, but I was dreading sharing a cramped space with all of their stuff...I thought we would be climbing all over each other and their 30 pairs of shoes. But we stayed in the Executive One Bedroom Suite at the Kimberly for $420/night, and it was HUGE...king bedroom and nice masterbath, second 1/2 bath (godsend!), large living room/dining room combination with pull-out sofa bed (queen size, I think), fully-equipped kitchen (nice way to save a little money in an expensive city!), dining room that seats 6, balcony with a view of the Chrysler building, and 5 closets. Compare that to any accomodations for 4 in Times Square -- or even an apartment rental -- and you'll see what an incredible deal that is. (Book early...I think they only have one with a second half bath). They also have luxury suites with upgraded bathrooms, but this was very nice and perfect for our family.
reviews.title: A good, not great option for those needing suites.

reviews.text: Great location in mid-town so you can get anywhere you want to go easily. I highly recommend this hotel, especially for families with teenagers (btw: I didn't think it was possible, but we spent 10 days on vacation with our daughters and never heard "I'm SO BORED" once!....Worth every penny!)
reviews.title: Great Location and Value!

reviews.text: Stayed at the Kimberly Sept 11-15. Had stayed at the Waldorf previously but needed a two bedroom suite with kitchenette and this fit the bill. The location is superb; easily within walking distance of any midtown adventure you would want.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel !

likes.liked: — Fantastic service,quality acommodation,very clean and quiet,excellent location

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.text: My family of four has just returned from New York and spent two nights at the Kimberly Hotel. Had we planned to stay longer or had it only been my husband I, we would have left and moved up the street to the Waldorf or the Palace; however we had two chldren with us and the Kimberly, formerly an apartment building, had two room "suites", an ideal set-up for families. The good news: the Kimberly's one bedroom suite was good sized; did have a balcony, a kitchen and is in a convenient mid-town location.

reviews.title: Kimberly OK place to stay
reviews.text: The negatives began at arrival. My children and arrived on an early flight knowing that our room would not be ready for several hours. We were prepared for this. I asked for a time to return and was told 1:00 P.M. Shortly before 2:00 P.M. we arrived back and when I inquired about the status of our room, was told it was not ready. Again, asking when we might return, I was told in a very terse voice to come back in a half hour. We did and this time without dierctly responding to my question, the clerk said "give them room 21D." At no time during these exchanges did this man engage in more than the necessary words to convey the information regarding a room.

reviews.title: Kimberly-Good place to stay
reviews.text: Arriving at our room, I thought I had thought I had walked into my great-aunt's apartment which had not seen an update in 20 or more years. The lighting was so bad (yellow tinge to everything) that even with all the lights on, it was difficult to read. The lamps, ceiling and wall lamps were either left over from the hotel conversion or were an attempt at "vintage lighting." Whatever the case, the effect was drab and dreary. When I attempted to turn the lamp on next to the bed, I noticed the light socket was out of the lamp. Calling the front desk, I began to inquire about a replacement lamp and the phone clicked in my ear as I was speaking. Calling back again, a gentleman came up, put the socket back in the lamp and told me I could operate it from the wall and not to use the manual switch.

The wallpaper border was peeling off from the wall, the carpet was more than just a little old and dated but also stained. The furniture was a 1970s fake french provincial; the bathtub had part of the faucet hanging off and worst of all an alleged non-smoking room had a definite smell of smoke which apparently the management encourages as there were ashtrays in the drawers. All in all it was a drab and dreary place to spend a couple of nights not to mention the headache from the cigarette smell.
reviews.title: We loved this place!!!!!!!

reviews.text: We are not high maintenance travelers; however, we do expect some basic level of service from a hotel. When my husband arrived in the afternoon and asked for a key to the room, he had to ask the woman at the desk if she wanted to see his I.D. And perhaps it was the treatment by the desk staff that seemed to leave such a poor impression of the hotel. At no time, at check in or check out, did anyone ask if there was anythng they could do for us or gave us the usual "have a nice time in ..... and if there is anything we can do for you" recitation. The two times I called the front desk regarding the lamp issue, I was not greeted by name (even the Holiday Inn Express answers "Hello Ms......" When I checked out, the woman at the front desk did not ask me if we enjoyed our stay, either at the Kimberly (no) or in New York (yes). The coincierge was so busy on the telephone talking to whomever that it took a half hour to arrange for a car to take us back to the airport. Thank goodness we didn't need help with tickets or information as to where to go or how to get around.
reviews.title: Excellent choice, excellent location.

reviews.text: This hotel was cute, a little run down but I had a beautiful room with an okay view. I was one level below the penthouse floor so I was up high with views of other buildings and their roof top gardens. Some employees went out of their way to make you feel welcome while others waited for you to acknowledge them first. Overall I had a good experience and the size of my room greatly surprised me, it was huge!
reviews.title: Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This boutique hotel is a secret gem. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone that would love to stay in a highly appointed hotel. The rooms are oversized to say the least with private living room wet bar and private balcony.
reviews.title: What a great find.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Executive One bedroom Suite at the Kimberly. The location is awesome and the room decor, size & cleanliness were very good. Staff was quite rude. But the 700 sq feet suite made us forget about the rudeness of the staff. The roof top bar known as "Upstairs" is definitely a must do for anyone staying at the hotel or nearby, especially for after dinner cocktails. The management at the hotel must fix 2 things to make us return to the Kimberly, one is the rudeness of the staff must be addressed, you cannot have an attitude if you are in the hospitality industry, second is the only 1 lobby bathroom situation. If you have strict 3pm check in time or strict early check out policy, you leave many hotel guests stranded. Us and many other guests needed to use the bathroom after getting to the hotel but because the Kimberly has only 1 unisex bathroom for guests & employees it was terrilbly busy and dirty, leaving a lot of guests & us stranded to use facilities elsewhere. That may be minor to many travelers but if one has used any public or fast food restrooms in New York they will soon appreciate why I am recommending the Kimberly Hotel install at least 2 bathrooms in the Lobby. Overall experience was good!
reviews.title: good overall Hotel & Location

reviews.text: This was a well-maintained older hotel which is often not the case in NYC. On the pricey side, but worth it if space is important as it is to our family of four. Nicely appointed kitchen with fridge, micro, and toaster. Would stay here again. Stayed in an executive suite on the 16th floor. Moderate noise level.
reviews.title: Lived up to the reviews

reviews.text: Kimberly it's a nice place to stay. Staff is helpfull, room is a little dark (great for sleeping). Tv it's great. Internet connection sucks and mobile gsm coverage was really bad in my room. Room service is reasonably priced and was really fast. Laundry service was not totals acceptable: No pick up withouth call, one day late delivery: ask to concierge to help you with laundry.
reviews.title: Business week
Perfect Pick
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at The Kimberly Oct 09-12 2010. The location is great, quiet for Midtown. You are within walking distance to Time Square and Central Park plus many more tourist spots. Our room was a nice size and the king bed was extremely comfortable. The price included a nice full breakfast including an omelette bar. The staff was courteous and helpful, especially the female concierge. After a day of touring it felt like coming home. I can't imagine staying anywhere else!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had the pleasure of spending the Columbus Day weekend in the City, and chose the Kimberly Hotel as our lodging for a Fri-Mon trip. We are not frequent travelers to NYC, and wanted to make the most of our short time there. The staff at The Kimberly was very accommodating to all of our questions! The staff is very knowledgeable about the city. Concierge was very helpful, and the doormen were awesome!
reviews.title: A gem in Midtown Manhattan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the 8th floor of the small building, and we had a terrace with outdoor furniture. It was a nice place to sit and relax. The bed and linens were very comfortable, and the blackout curtains worked well. The room was clean, and quite comfortable for the two of us.
reviews.title: Love this hotel

reviews.text: The breakfast in the 30th floor lounge each morning is quite good, with a small buffet and made to order omelets. Made for a great start to each day. We did not have dinner at the hotel lounge, but did have drinks, and it is a great, upscale atmosphere. It caters to a well dressed clientele. Several people I spoke with raved about the food in the evenings.
reviews.title: Great hotel for families looking for space in a NYC hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One quibble with the layout of the hotel is two separate buildings. If you are in the smaller building, you have to bump the luggage carts down 2 small stairs. The bell staff/doormen are very helpful however, and more than make up for this little inconvenience.
reviews.title: Comfortable, Spacious Luxury Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived late on a Friday evening and were given room 5F. I had booked with Expedia, and reserved a one bedroomed luxury suite, which was supposed to be on the 23rd floor or above. The room itself would've been fine, but it was at the back of the hotel and really noisy. I had also read previous reviews saying that you get woken up by early morning deliveries. After a long discussion with reception, and as we were totally knackered, we accepted their offer of an executive suite on the 30th floor for an extra $125 per night! That took away $500 of our budget straight away!
reviews.title: Not bad if you get the room you expected - great location

reviews.text: That is a major lesson learnt - dont book with Expedia as they charge you the full amount at the time of booking, and you don't get what you really think you're going to get. I wish I had booked directly with hotel and specified a high floor.
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect!! - Could not have had a better experience!

reviews.text: We went up to the rooftop bar on the first night as we really needed a drink after all that stress. Although the view was great, the atmosphere was non existant. We paid about £40 in total for 2 light beers and 2 vodka and diet cokes!!!! Needless to say we didnt go back again.
reviews.title: good sized rooms but welcome tray needs attention

reviews.text: Our (expensive) suite was fantastic, huge, clean, well decorated, and everything you needed apart from a kettle. We had to boil water in the microwave to make my morning cuppa. I dont know how they expect you make one when they provide tea bags, cups, cuttlery, a coffee machine, with all the filters and coffee - a kettle would've been handy!
reviews.title: If you want a place to sleep --- this is NOT the place for you

reviews.text: The water pressure in the shower was intermittant. When trying to wash my hair it would go from a trickle to a blast of cold - very annoying. The bed was very very comfortable, so lovely to sleep in - lots of pillows and extra blankets if needed.
reviews.title: If you are staying in New York try this hotel
Believe the great reviews!
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed everything about our recent 6 night stay at the Kimberly. The staff is helpful, friendly and courteous. The Kimberly resides in a safe and centrally located part of Manhattan. This was our first trip to NYC and we were able to walk or take the subway to any part of Manhattan with little or no direction. Our hotel room was nicely appointed with a great bed and full kitchen. We took the subway to Union Square for groceries at Trader Joe's and/or Whole Foods and saved a lot of money preparing our own meals using all the dishes and utensils provided. Also, our suite was the quietest room we've ever stayed in; we heard no "neighbor noise" the entire time! Believe all these positive reviews - this is a wonderful place to stay and we will do so again on our next trip to the city.

My husband and I stayed here June 8-15, we were very pleased with our suite, noise was not a problem, (ear plugs provided but not necessary) The staff were courteous and pleasant, and efficiently handled our few requests. We were very impressed with the doormen, not only were they helpful, they rushed to open doors and always greeted us with a big smile. Great location, and the river cruise is an added bonus. Will definately stay at the Kimberly again, and will recommend it to our friends.
reviews.title: Superb Kimberly
Great Location!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Kimberly from 6/11 to 6/15/06. Great hotel, location, service!! We were given hotel options by our travel agent and after checking the reviews of all on tripadvisor.com we selected The Kimberly (145 East 50th). The room size was perfect (small apartment size) and very clean. Was better than any other hotel we have stayed in....bed was so comfortable and the down pillows were an extra touch. The hotel staff were very friendly and professional....especially Edgar (night desk) and Ralph (doorman). You can't beat the location as it is close to restaurants, museums, United Nations, etc.. At night we felt it was very safe to walk to dinner or just walk, walk, walk. We ate almost every morning at the New York Luncheonette two doors away....good food at reasonable prices. A block over, AuBonPain is great for pastries, coffee, bagel. Subway entrance is really close to the Kimberly and we took advantage of that by riding to Union Square to Havana Central (delicious Cuban food!) for dinner. If you are looking for a quiet bar/lounge (with windows for people watching) then try Lily's which is just a block over from the hotel. Really can't say enough good things about this hotel. Would definitely stay there again!

I simply will not stay anyplace else. We have lived in NYC and this was the best of returns. The location ,near the Lex subway, the bus, the restaurants, and Bloomies , is wonderful .It is the staff from the doormen , who run the street, to the concierge and all the others who make your stay so enjoyable. Very confortable rooms with storage that is unusual. Beds to die for!
reviews.title: Fantastic elegance, location and service .
Excellent
reviews.text: Excellent Hotel. Large Rooms, Well-Appointed and Clean. I wish I could have stayed longer.

I stayed at The Kimberly for only one night on a business trip in April 05. I loved it... The down comforter was amazing!!! They had a great supply of all newspapers available in the lobby for free. I was in a small suite and loved it - tons of space and soo comfortable.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.text: I am planning another business trip and while curious about other hotels I am seriously considering The Kimberly again.
reviews.title: I LOVE this hotel!
Fantastic hotel!
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights here end of August. It was PERFECT with our toddler son -- he slept in the living room and we had the bedroom and bathroom. All BIG rooms -- so unusual for NYC. It was great having a kitchen -- especially with all the good deli's and convenience stores nearby. We would come back from walking all over the city and relax with milk for the toddler, and drinks for us. In general, it was one of our favorite locations -- near Rockefeller Center and Time Square and short walk to the Park. And a nice residential feel with small cafes just a block over on 2nd.

Our bed was fabulous with soft pillow top and awesome linens -- better than any Westin Heavenly bed I have slept in. The shower was good, and with our inside location we had NO street noise -- it was soo quiet. The staff was nice, although not terribly well informed. But, with wireless connections in the rooms, you can just look stuff up online anyway.
reviews.title: The Kimberly is Great

reviews.text: My wife spent days researching hotels online and we decided to try this one. We are very glad we did. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay August 28 through September 1. The beautiful suite was very clean and nicely appointed. The staff was very helpful and extremely friendly. The kitchen came in handy for breakfasts and the pillow top bed was very comfortable. Our daughter spent a couple of nights and slept in the sofa bed. We will definitely return to this lovely hotel.
reviews.title: Good location / tidy rooms

reviews.text: We booked through expedia and were given what I assume was one of the rooms saved for customers who book through discount travel websites such as expedia. It was a large room but had minimal furniture so it seemed kind of empty. The window had bird crap on it and was a really ugly view of the roof of another building. All in all we got a good deal so it was probably worth what we paid. Didn't love it, didn't hate it. It was clean enough that I didn't get freaked out and I am a bit of a neat freak. Loved the luncheonette a few doors down for breakfast. Would recommend if you are on a budget and you aren't looking for anything fancy.
reviews.title: Good location, given the 'expedia' room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very large (considering what we are used to in London) with a large bed area, bathroom and dressing area. Fully equipped etc, very comfy bed and helpful staff. Some of the throughways are a little tired, but the hotel is in a perfect location for all the key sights - very important to us as we were on limited time. We walked everywhere - Broadway about 15 mins, Rockerfella Centre 10 mins, St Pauls Cathedral 5 mins, Grand Central about 10 mins. Loads of places to eat nearby. They have a great rooftop terrace restaurant with lovely views of the Chrysler Building, especially at night. The food we ate there was delicious, albeit it is pricey and you don't get a good hearty meal. Would definitely stay there agin if we ever where to return.
reviews.title: Perfect location and very comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights at the Kimberley. This was a Priceline booking who rate it at 3.5*, which was about right. I would say it was not up to 5*. From the outside it is not impressive but the rooms were functional. Take care not to have a room at the back of the Hotel - we did on the first night - as the noise from aircon plant below is bad. When we changed to the front it was fine and more spacious. We found the staff good and responsive to questions. Service was good. The big highlight here is their link to the NY Health & Requets Club - they have free passes to their cruiser for a sunset cruise down the East River and up the Hudson with 25$ buffet (which we weren't charged for!) and we loved this. Location good for Midtown.
reviews.title: About what you would expect for 3.5*

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a Deluxe room at the Kimberly in May for 3 nights to complete a 3 week trip to California and NY in September to celebrate my husbands birthday. Every hotel we stayed in during our wonderful trip met and exceeded our expectations for their cleanliness, quality and customer service. We both love NY and during previous trips to NY we have stayed in the fabulous Michelangelo but I opted for a change of location and having read the reviews and checked out the website and the price ($309 per night excluding tax and fees) thought the standards would be the same. How wrong I was! The receptionist never made eye contact with us once during the check in process or provided us with any information about the hotel other than our room number (7H). When making the booking in May, I had requested a King room and stated that we were in NY for a celebration. I was very dissapointed to find that the room we were given had two double beds and the view from our window was the air conditioning units, a massive pile of bricks and directly facing the bedrooms of another hotel (not reflecting any of the images I had seen on their hotel website). On contacting the front desk to tell them I was not happy about the room and pointing out that our booking was made way back in May I was told that the hotel was full and that there were no other rooms available. This indicates that they pay no heed to any special requests so why ask? We reported the noisy and rattling air conditioning which was never fixed and there was constant noise from banging doors when the cleaning staff were servicing the rooms. To sum up; our far from luxurious 3 night stay cost more than $1000 dollars resulted in 3 sleepless nights in a room where we could not open the blinds and we had to sleep in separate beds. Not the romantic end to our wonderful holiday that I had planned! The customer service from the reception staff was non existent (with the exception of the doormen and the bell staff who were all very helpful and kind) as we had similar treatment on asking someone to look at the air conditioning and at checkout. I cannot comment on the food or the rooftop bar as I refused to give them any more of my custom and we opted to eat and drink in places where we were treated with respect and were made to feel welcome.
reviews.title: An expensive mistake!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We came with another couple for a 6 night stay to attend the US Open. We have been coming to NYC in the fall for the last 5 years and choose to stay in midtown for the convenience - always in a different hotel. I think we finally found our favorite! For a rate in the low $200's - our "guestroom" on the 7th floor and facing east 50th was spacious with a desk, table and 2 comfortable chairs, large closet, safe, coffee maker, plasma tv, iron and regular size board, and a nearly empty refrigerator for storing your own food and refreshments. On the desk, an informational computer showed the weekly temperature as well as hotel features. Good size bathroom with plenty of shelf room for toiletries.
reviews.title: Highly recommend for a Delightful stay in midtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The earlier reviews of this place are pretty accurate:- friendliness of the staff, convenient location,
reviews.title: great big rooms, short on common areas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: traditional style. Three points to emphasise though.
reviews.title: Nice Boutique Hotel In Midtown East

reviews.text: Our room ( a one bedroom suite) was even better than I expected; 2 full sized rooms well designed and luxuriously decorated.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: The "Upstairs" Bar is pretty trendy and hence very popular and crowded in the evenings, also closed for private functions in the daytime on 2 occasions during our 4 nigh stay. There are no other residents lounges or restaurants on the premises.
reviews.title: space space space
Excellent!
reviews.text: This is a very nice little hotel in the midtown east area of Manhattan. It's actually a pretty good value if you can get a good price through an internet provider (Priceline, Hotwire, etc.). Small lobby area with enough room for about 8 people to sit. The bell service personnel are first rate. Extremely friendly and professional. The rooms are spacious and clean. However, if you want a room with a view, I suggest asking for a room above the 8th floor. We were on the sixth floor in the side tower which fronted 50th street. It got a little noisy by around 7 am and there wasn't a view. As for the location, if you want to be in midtown east, there aren't too many better locations than this. The Kimberly is situated about one block east of the Waldorf Astoria and within 4-6 blocks to MOMA, the Chrysler Building, Grand Central Station, Fifth Avenue Shopping (Tiffany's, Bergdorf Goodman, Saks), and close to Central Park. FYI, the facade is being renovated right now so if construction bothers you, don't stay there for the next 2-3 months. I would definitely stay there again if I wanted to be in midtown east.

My family and I stayed at this hotel for two nights. The lobby is tiny, but very warm and welcoming. We stayed at a one bedroom suite. The rooms were at a very reasonable price: about #300 per night. They were quite small, like the lobby, but very comfortable. I liked that there was a fully-equipped kitchen, and a nice dining room. The beds were relaxing, but the queen sized sofa bed was too springy and when I woke up, my back was aching. There were great amenities, but the Internet access is a little pricey. (I mean, $7.95 for 24 hours!) There is a printer/fax/copier on the desk too. The service is extremely friendly; they are polite and very kind to children. The dining here is great too. I have tried their breakfast buffet, and it was very good. On weekdays, the breakfast buffet is free for people staying at the hotel, but for outsiders, it is not complimentary. Overall, it was a very nice stay at the Kimberly Hotel.
reviews.title: It was pretty good!

reviews.text: Just back from a great ladies getaway for a long weekend of eating, shopping, theatre-going and laughing! The Kimberly was an important factor in our enjoyable escape. The doormen were all very helpful and charming. The room was very comfortable,quiet and spacious ( by N.Y. standards) and the bed very comfy. The A/C worked very well during our extremely hot weather. Having been many times to N.Y. this hotel ranks highly in my mind. Location is ideal......close to Bloomingdales- 5 min. walk...and not far from Rockefellar Center and Fifth Ave. Fine breakfast places nearby.
reviews.title: Great Giirls Weekend!!

reviews.text: I can't remember when I've stayed in a nicer hotel. The location was wonderful. The rooms are small but very comfortable. At night your bed is turned down and they put music on from the bose clock radio. There was a good size refrigerator and icrowave. The refrigerator even had an ice maker. There are plush terry cloth robes you can use. There's even a pillow menu. You can chose from 1 of 10 pillow types. The bathroom is very nice and clean. If you want a nice view you're going to have to sacrifice quiet. The inside suites are facing other apartment buildings but the upside is the room is quiet. There's a great lunchenette right down the street. We ate both dinner and lunch there once. All in all I think this was a great hotel. I would go back in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: loved this hotel!!!

likes.liked: — The hotel had a nice old world charm to it

reviews.text: i read how great this place was and must admit i was quite disapointed. I stayed in 3J. I arrived last week sunday to the NY heat wave to discover that i was never going to get the room cool with the 100 year old airconditioner that seems to exist in so many old ny hotels.
reviews.title: not great when NY is hot

reviews.text: Other than that the stay was fine but nothing memorable. Maybe a touch bigger than the cool boutique hotels, bed was good, but otherwise disapointing after reading reviews.
reviews.title: That's right - believe the great reviews!

likes.disliked: — Some fixtures showing signs of age; very minor concern.

reviews.title: Summer in the City!
reviews.text: Stayed for one night at the Kimberly. Had an executive King suite with a balcony overlooking 50th. The great room was really large with a kitchenette and comfy sofa (a little worn). The bedroom had a great bed with featherbed and down comforter and tons of pillows. The sheets were high quality as well. The bathroom was old and a little small but clean and good shower pressure. The staff was exceptionally nice and took great care of us. We used the concierge extensively and she did a great job. I highly reccommend the NYHRC cruise - pretty casual, edible food, cheap price and the best (albeit expensive) long-island Iced Tea I've ever had.

reviews.title: Great Value, Great Service!
reviews.text: The only reason I don't give it a 5 is that I paid ~$525, for one night including room service breakfast (very overpriced and not very good) so I don't think it was a great value. But I enjoyed it anyway!

reviews.title: Stayed at the Kimberly June 24-27
reviews.text: My wife, two small children and I stayed at the Kimberly last May. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. We found the hotel to be a great value and centrally located. The hotel restaurant is also excellent and family friendly. We will recommend the Kimberly to friends.

reviews.title: Huge room for New York, and most comfortable bed EVER!
reviews.text: I had a confirmed reservation made two months before arriving for a 2 bedr, 2 bath suite - upon arrival was told I was being upgraded to a 3 bedr suite - how nice! Only problem was 3 bedr had no living room and no full kitchen and we needed those rooms for our group of 6. They moved us to 2 one bedr suites across the hall from each other - beds were comfortable, pull out sofa not comfortable - you could feel the springs - good location, nice doormen, and I would ask for terrace with a view - our first 3 bedr upgrade had a beat up looking terrace and looked into another bulding - depressing - other than the reservation being not what I wanted we all said we'd stay again -

reviews.title: Loved it-want to go back!
reviews.text: After a recommendation and lots of research, we chose The Kimberly for a short stop off in New York this past May. The hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating and allowed us to check in early at 10am as we arrived fresh off a red eye from San Francisco, California. The hotel's common space is on the smaller size since this is a boutique hotel, but the one bedroom suite we stayed in more than made up for that! There is a nice sized kitchen complete w/ stove, oven, dishwasher, and refridgerator, spacious living room area w/ a sofa and television, and large bedroom, esp for New York. The bed had to have been at least a King (if not Cal. King) and was THE MOST comfortable bed I have ever slept in at a hotel. Crisp linens, plenty of pillows, and a high quality feather bed to top if off!! Room was quiet except for some morning traffic noise that filtered in. Only complaint is the bathroom is small and some of the decor was a bit dated and tired (hence the above average rating), but the hotel's prime location, room size, bed, and overall price is unbeatable. Also, many discount sites offer lower rates for this hotel. I would definately stay here again.

We had a very comfortable suite at good rate for 5 adults. Convenient location for shops/transport etc. Staff very friendly. Rooms very clean and a great views from the 30th. Some minor wear and tear in room but nothing significant.
reviews.title: Great space for 5 adults at the Kimberly

likes.liked: — CAPACITY OF ROOMS AT THAT PRICE
likes.disliked: — LITTLE BITS OF WEAR AND TEAR

reviews.text: We stayed at the Kimberly on the weekend of the NYC Marathon. The location is very convenient- the corner of Lexington and E.50th, one block from a subway stop. The room was immaculate and the beds were wonderfully comfortable. The staff was friendly and anxious to please. I will definitely stay at Kimberly on future trips to NY.
reviews.title: loved the kimberly

reviews.text: Per the recommendation of one of my colleagues, I stayed here on a recent business trip. By NYC standards, the room and bathroom were large. Both were clean but a little worn around the edges--small chips on the furniture, some staining on the grouting in the tub, etc. However, everything I needed was there: two very comfortable and luxuriously dressed beds, iron/ironing board, hairdryer, bathrobes, small fridge, good sized closet and, down in the lobby, staff members that were very polite and eager to please. Staff quickly got me a cab when I needed it, but the Lexington/51st Street subway stop is literally just around the corner. I paid $255 a night, and although that's not cheap by any means, it is a very competitive price for NYC right now. Given its convenient midtown lcoation--Rockefeller Center is a couple of blocks away--the Kimberly was perfect for my trip.
reviews.title: Great location, large room, decent price
okay place, great location
reviews.text: I booked this trip 6 months ago and got a good price of $255/nite when most comparable places were over $300 at the time I booked. I think it's worth the money I paid, but nothing more. Front desk staff was nice but not terribly knowledgable nor seasoned. We checked in late (11pm) and were given a room with 2 double beds instead of the queen/king we'd requested. (It was our anniversary). They said they never "guaranteed" those requests, but said they'd check in the morning. Sure enough, they moved us the next day (had to repack!!) to a room in the front of the building w/ a king bed. Double paned windows reduced the street noise just fine (we're used to a little urban noise). Size was decent for a NYC hotel room; bed and linens were really nice, and there were 2 dressers and a small closet. Bathroom was okay, but NO counterspace or any place to put toiletries. (The first room we had actually had a lot of counterspace AND a separate dressing room with a counter.) Overall, the place needs sprucing up - chipped surfaces, dusty fixtures (including the coffeemaker!), showing its age. There are 3 other hotels in the same block which, at times, have had competitve prices. They all looked nicer. Restaurant next to the hotel looked JUST okay (I"m a food snob); the bar was fun, with impromptu opera and jazz singers taking the mike. The best bagels in the world around the corner on Third Ave. Great location in Midtown East, easy to get up- or downtown by walking. Subway stops close to get anywhere. Not a bad experience for the price and location.

Our family of four just returned from a lovely 4-night stay at the Kimberly. Our one-bedroom suite was spacious and well appointed, although my son preferred to sleep on the sofa itself rather than the sofa bed. The bed linens, robes and towels were of very high quality. Having a kitchen is a godsend when traveling with children in an expensive city. We were on a low floor on the back, which meant that we had no street noise (a very welcome change from our last stay at a different NYC hotel), but the proximity to the air-conditioning units meant that we couldn't use the balcony. There was plenty of closet space. The bell staff and doormen could not have been better. The location - a fairly quiet hotel-laden street - was excellent as well.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice for Familes

reviews.text: I stayed here with 2 others for a long weekend. We had a 2 bedroom suite with views of the Hudson. The rooms are large.The suite was just as it appears in the hotel photographs. Nicely furnished, quality bed linen and very well equipped. The staff could not have been more helpful. The hotel position is perfect. If I visit NYC again I would definitely return to the Kimberly.
reviews.title: A great place to stay

reviews.text: I have stayed in this small hotel in New York City for years. Outstanding location and service.You can walk to Central Park and Time Squuare.Many great restaurants in the area.The rooms are large. Visit the Rooftop Bar.The service at the hotel is friendly and accomadateing.Check in is always fast.You never have to wait for an elevator.I will be coming back next April. Make sure you keep checking thier rates they countiue to reduce them.I have always found that they have the best value in New York.We always stay in a one bedroom suite.The rooms have just been newly decorated.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a last minute room here through the hotel tonight app at a modest discount ($212). I was impressed with what I got for that. The lobby is small and a little shabby, but you're not staying there so no big deal.
reviews.title: decent midtown hotel that you can get a deal on through hoteltonight

reviews.text: My room was on the 5th floor, executive tower. Nice size with a large bathroom. The carpet was a little worn ( my impression that was this side of the hotel was overdue for a renovation), but given the discount I didn't ask to be moved. It was good enough for the money and I was barely there .
reviews.title: Rooftop Bar

reviews.text: The location was great with subway and shopping close by. The roof bar is a cool place for a drink, though I was stopped at the outside elevator by a bouncer and told I couldn't go up due to the "no sneakers" policy. I thought that was a little harsh as it was after midnight on a Thursday and I was a guest. Fortunately the inside elevator also goes to the rooftop bar, so I made it without incident that way (the bouncer was none too happy when I came down though...he gave my feet a good look and then gave the evil eye to me).
reviews.title: Will be back again!

reviews.text: I just spent what will probably come to be known as the Blizzard of 2010 at the Kimberly. Upon checking in we were upgraded to a one bedroom luxury suite. This is always a pleasant and unexpected surprise. The room was lovely and clean as a whistle. My fussy niece could not say enough about the comfort of the beds. All amenities were without flaw. Not fabulous, but certainly without flaw. I bugged the staff quite a bit, especially with issues resulting from the storm, and everyone was gracious and helpful. Not in the thick of things but certainly within moderate walking distance. It irks me to see certain complaints come up with reviews for NYC hotels - "lousy view". What were you expecting, a sun-drenched meadow? You don't go to a big city for the view because most likely there is none. Also, a hotel has no control over street noises so....you request a room away from the street, easy. These issues should never be part of a review, at least for a New York hotel. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.
reviews.title: Could Not Find A Single Fault

reviews.text: I stayed several times in New York, with mixed hotel experiences. Some expensive hotels are disappointing, not clean etc. Because of the good reviews I decided to try the Kimberly hotel. Two things are important to me: clean rooms and little noise (which is difficult in NYC). The Kimberly Hotel was great! Large, luxurious rooms! I had a room on the back of the hotel, which was really quiet at night (except the noise of airco`s). The location is ok, there is a subway station nearby, but not ideal for sightseeing and shopping.
reviews.title: great hotel for a good price

reviews.text: Rooms are excellent, and interior is luxurious but management fails to meet the expectations of its standards. I had an ..... experience with housekeeping. I also had kind of ... experience upstairs restaurant. Hotel has newest technology of touch screen, unfortunately no clue how to repair it when it fails. Despite reporting 3-4 formal request, I didn`t received even a courtesy call from Management to let me know they care about it. Overall I do agree that that suite and interior is excellent but management not to expectations and lack of well trained personal leaves you an unpleasant stay.
reviews.title: Excellant hotel but lack of well trained staff .....

reviews.text: I was travelling with my best friend, we were in New York for a girly break and shopping trip, we checked into the hotel 28th nov 2010, whn we checked in we were told we had been upgraded to a suite on the 23rd floor free of charge, the room was excellent, it had a balcony wiv a gr8 view of the chrysler building the bathroom was amazin with a jucuzzi bath and tv and again and amzing view,we were delighted, the staff were very friendly and helpfull throughout, on the last day there was aterrible rain storm and myself and my friend were soaked through and we had already had checked out the room, the kind staff were very accomodating and gave us an area to organise ourselves and a hairdryer to dry off and generally looked after us very well when they didnt need to, overall i would definately recomend the kimberly i have been to new york many times but this was the best experience i have had
reviews.title: staff were very helpfull, great place to stay

reviews.text: My girls and I traveled to NYC for Thanksgiving and tried the Kimberly for the first time. I have stayed in many different hotels throughout NYC and we are thrilled that we stayed at the Kimberly. The staff are so friendly and took wonderful care of my girls and I. The roof top bar/lounge is great for both breakfast and for an adult get away. The suites are spacious and views are spetacular. I am thrilled that I have found a hotel that I can use for both my vacation and business travel needs.
reviews.title: Best Thanksgiving Vacation and Stay

description: The Kimberly is a traditionally styled, boutique suite hotel located between 3rd & Lexington Avenues. With 30 rooms ranging from 266 to 372 sq ft and 158 suites, ranging from 460 to 935 sq ft., we offer personalized service from a warm and caring staff. Most of our suites have balconies, a rarity in NYC and many offer views of the city. Our mattresses are covered with feather beds and decked with Frette linens, which earn comments such as "I didn't want to get up" from our guests. A bonus here, is that in addition to our on-site fitness center, work-out enthusiasts can use any of the NY Heatlth and Racquet Club's 9 locations, including pools and work-out classes at no additional cost and can enjoy a cruise for three hours on their 75 ft yacht (in season) for a fee of $25 which includes a light buffet supper.
